DataElement.preferredName: Marijuana Short Form Marijuana Craving Questionnaire (MCQ-SF) Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any part of, or extract from, the female hemp plant Cannabis sativa.  Marijuana contains cannabinoids, substances with hallucinogenic, psychoactive, and addictive properties.  This agent has potential use for treating cancer pain and cachexia. (NCI04)_Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration._A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out._Any part of, or extract from, the female hemp plant Cannabis sativa.  Marijuana contains cannabinoids, substances with hallucinogenic, psychoactive, and addictive properties.  This agent has potential use for treating cancer pain and cachexia. (NCI04)_The desire to experience the effect(s) of a previously used psycho-active substance. It has to be noted that not all drug craving is based on withdrawal, since craving can often occur in the absence of withdrawal._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out.

Any part of, or extract from, the female hemp plant Cannabis sativa.  Marijuana contains cannabinoids, substances with hallucinogenic, psychoactive, and addictive properties.  This agent has potential use for treating cancer pain and cachexia. (NCI04)

The desire to experience the effect(s) of a previously used psycho-active substance. It has to be noted that not all drug craving is based on withdrawal, since craving can often occur in the absence of withdrawal.
